dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2102 IH: More Job Opportunities and Business Startups for Rural Areas Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kihuen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Investment Company Act of 1940 to require a report on improving access to capital in rural areas for small businesses and qualifying venture capital funds.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the More Job Opportunities and Business Startups for Rural Areas Act or the More JOBS for Rural Areas Act.

section.header: SEC report improving access to capital in rural areas
section.text: The Securities and Exchange Commission shall issue a report on improving access to capital in rural areas, includingâ€”

paragraph.text: best practices to improve investor base and small businesses seeking access to capital;
recommendations for technological advances for communications between investors and small businesses;
improving increased awareness for rural area small businesses about venture capitalists funding opportunities;
recommendations to small businesses to learn about diverse forms of capital to create innovation and jobs in rural areas; and
assessment on factors currently inhibiting access to capital in rural areas and recommendations to expand access.

section.text: This report shall be issued to the committees of jurisdiction one year after enactment and shall be a one-time report.
